revised_title: Reports from the Royal Society's Kala Azar Commission in China: New Parasites of the Striped Hamster
tldr: This article reports on the discovery of three new parasites found in striped hamsters and the effects of X-rays on living tissues. Trypanosoma cricetuli and Grahamella cricetuli were found in the blood and red cells of hamsters, while Sarcosporidia were present in the subcutaneous muscles. The article also discusses the potential impact of X-rays on tissue cells and the need for more numerical data to develop a physical theory of their action.
